description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (To enlarge the residential flats to the rear) in relation to planning permission reference 205308FUL dated 03/06/2021 for 'Construction of fourth floor to a main building; internal and external alterations; construction of attached six storey building with basement excavation to create additional 5 No. residential units (total of 15 residential units on site); and provision of associated refuse, cycle storage and associated landscaping'
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of the original permission (205308FUL).

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): P-001 Site Location Plan; P-101C Existing Ground Floor Plan; P-102C Proposed Ground Floor Plan; P-103C Existing & Proposed LG Floor Plan; P-104A Existing & Proposed 1F Plan; P-105A Existing & Proposed 2F Plan; P-106C Existing & Proposed 3F Plan; P-107C Existing & Proposed 4F Plan; P-108 B Existing & Proposed 5F Plan.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used for extending the principal building of the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form, with the exception of windows to the infill extension which shall be grey aluminium framed.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan (2021) policies D1, D3, D4 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Flat 13, as indicated on the approved plans, shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Building Regulations Part M4(3)(2)(b), to be a wheelchair user home. Evidence demonstrating compliance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure wheelchair units would be capable of providing adequate amenity in accordance with the London Housing SPG (2016) and the London Plan (2021) policy D5. | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The external noise levels, sound insulation of the building envelope and best practicable mitigation measures shall be in accordance with the approved drawings and documents within application reference: 214435CND dated 05.11.2021.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 and D6 of The London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The demolition method statement/ construction management plan shall be in accordance with the approved drawings and documents within application reference: 214570CND dated 12.01.2022.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | The glazing to units facing the atrium area shall be in accordance with the approved drawings and documents within application reference: 214571CND dated 20.08.2021.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of adjacent units and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); London Plan (2021) policies D3 and D6. | Flank balustrades to the terrace of Flat 17 shall have a height of at least 1.8m from floor level.

Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | At least six (6) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site for the new flats prior to occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2 | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the forecourt area of the property and made available for use in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
